cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the Florida east coast before moving toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal approach near the Georgia/South Carolina border (Savannah River–Edisto Beach stretch)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Savannah River to Edisto Beach, SC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach, FL to Fernandina Beach, FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. Atlantic coast from central Florida through Georgia to South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds increasingly likely (57% chance) with a 24% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Friday night–Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC indicates potential 5–8 ft inundation for Sebastian Inlet FL to Savannah River GA; values above 3 ft are probable along the Georgia coast including Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood threat in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; possible minor river flooding and debris flow impacting port access roads.
